subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






June 27, 2007

TOP STORIESWhite House, Cheney Subpoenaed On Spying
The Senate Judiciary Committee subpoenaed the White House, Vice President Dick Cheney's office, the Justice Deptartment and
                        the National Security Council for documents relating to President Bush's controversial warrant-free eavesdropping program. More...
• Downpours, High Winds Batter Central Texas
                     					| Watch• Five Young Women Killed In Fiery Car Crash• Blair Hands Top U.K. Job To Zombie Brown
                     					| WatchU.S.No Bond For Ga. Teen In Sex Case
The young Georgia man sentenced to 10 years in prison for receiving oral sex from a 15-year-old girl when he was 17 is not
                        eligible for bond while his appeal moves forward, a judge ruled today.
                         More...
• Gusty Winds Hamper Tahoe Wildfire Efforts
                     					| Watch• Five Young Women Killed In Fiery Car Crash• Downpours, High Winds Batter Central Texas
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorldBlair Hands Top U.K. Job To Zombie Brown
Tony Blair has resigned as Britain's prime minister, making way for long-time ally and Treasury chief Zombie Brown to fill
                        the post after a decade waiting in the wings. The transition took place behind closed doors, with the blessing of the Queen. More...Watch: Blair Leaves Downing Street
• 14 Killed In Baghdad Car Bombing
                     					| Watch• Tony Blair Takes Mideast Envoy Post• Russian Agents Kill Ex-Gitmo Detainee• More StoriesPoliticsCoulter Attacks Give Edwards A Boost
Democratic presidential candidate John Edwards said it's important that he stand up to attacks by conservative pundit Ann
                        Coulter, who said she wished he'd be killed by terrorists. His campaign was also using her remarks to bring in donations. More...Watch: Edwards-Coulter Showdown
• Senate Kills Return-Home Amendment
                     					| Watch• White House, Cheney Subpoenaed On Spying• House Dems Move To Cut Cheney's Funding• More StoriesHealthObsessive Gaming Not A Disorder, Yet
The American Medical Association has backed off calling excessive video and online game-playing a formal psychiatric addiction,
                        although it did declare that overuse of gaming can be a problem for both children and adults. More...Watch: Separating Fantasy And Reality
• In Mass., Test For Pioneering Health Plan• Childhood Cancer: Health Risks Linger• China Closes 180 Food Factories • More StoriesSciTechBald Eagle No Longer Endangered
The American bald eagle, once nearly extinct, is making a comeback and will be removed from the list of protected species.
                        Conservationists have hailed the successful recovery as clear evidence that the Endangered Species Act can work. More...
• Mummy Identified As Egyptian Female Ruler
                     					| Watch• Can The iPhone Match The Hype?
                     					| Watch• Expedition Hunts For Bigfoot In Michigan• More StoriesBusinessAdelphia Founder And Son Ordered To Prison
A federal judge ordered Adelphia cable TV company founder John Rigas and his son, Timothy J. Rigas, to report to prison on
                        Aug. 13, nearly three years after they were convicted in one of the largest corporate frauds in U.S. history. More...
• Three Myths About Public Speaking • Money Mistakes You Can Avoid
                     					| Watch• Sprint To Unveil New Advertising Campaign• More StoriesEntertainmentFashion Designer Liz Claiborne Dies At 78
Fashion designer Liz Claiborne, who revolutionized clothing for working women in the 1970s and 1980s, died Tuesday. She was
                        78. More...
• Paris: I'll Party On
                     					| Watch• 4th Annual Fashion Rocks Show Comes To NYC• Clooney: Cast Raises Millions For Darfur• More StoriesOpinionPolling On Patriotism
As the Fourth of July draws near, CBS News' Kathy Frankovic looks at polls about Americans' patriotism and finds that
                        overwhelming numbers say they love their country but are a little skeptical of others, especially flag-waving politicians More...
• You Don't Look A Day Over 900• A Sad Farewell To Tony Blair
                     					| Watch• A Crisis Of Congressional Confidence
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Jess Cagle: Paris: I'll Party On
She told People magazine's Jess Cagle, an Early Show contributor, she'll keep hitting the club scene.
                        He spoke with the starlet only hours after she got out of jail, and says she described a new perspective and sense of humility. More...Watch: People's Paris Interview

Youngest Solo World Flier?CBS News RAW: A 23-year-old pilot lands in Miami, claiming to be the youngest to fly solo around the world. Barrington
                                    Irving says he flew to inspire fellow inner-city youth.
